action.action-desc: Mr. Cicilline introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Financial Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for the imposition of sanctions on persons who are officials of the Government of Iran or persons acting on behalf of that Government who are responsible for or complicit in human rights abuses committed against citizens of the United States or United States legal permanent resident aliens.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Iran Human Rights Accountability Act of 2018.

section.header: Imposition of sanctions on persons who are officials of the Government of Iran or persons acting on behalf of that Government who are responsible for or complicit in human rights abuses committed against citizens of the United States or United States legal permanent resident aliens

subsection.text: Section 105(b)(1) of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 (22 U.S.C. 8514(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the date of the enactment of this Act and inserting the date of the enactment of the Iran Human Rights Accountability Act of 2018; and
by inserting or against citizens of the United States or United States legal permanent resident aliens, after June 12, 2009,.

subsection.text: The Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 (22 U.S.C. 8501 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading of section 105, by inserting at the end before the period the following: or against citizens of the United States or United States legal permanent resident aliens; and
in the table of contents, by amending the item relating to section 105 to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 105. Imposition of sanctions on certain persons who are responsible for or complicit in human rights abuses committed against citizens of Iran or their family members after the June 12, 2009, elections in Iran or against citizens of the United States or United States legal permanent resident aliens.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and apply with respect to the commission of serious human rights abuses described in section 105 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 on or after such date of enactment.
